verses.verse: (Thanksgiving and Praise) Of David. (Ps 95.3; 96.4; 111.1) I give you thanks, O LORD, (Q mss Gk: MT lacks O LORD) with my whole heart; before the gods I sing your praise;

(1 Kings 8.29, 30; Ps 28.2; Isa 42.21) I bow down toward your holy temple and give thanks to your name for your steadfast love and your faithfulness, for you have exalted your name and your word above everything. (Cn: Heb you have exalted your word above all your name)
(Ps 28.7; 46.1; 118.5) On the day I called, you answered me; you increased my strength of soul. (Syr Compare Gk Tg: Heb you made me arrogant in my soul with strength)
(Ps 102.15) All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O LORD, for they have heard the words of your mouth.
They shall sing of the ways of the LORD, for great is the glory of the LORD.
(Ps 113.5, 6; Prov 3.34; Isa 57.15; Jas 4.6) For though the LORD is high, he regards the lowly, but the haughty he perceives from far away.
(Ps 20.6; 23.3, 4; 71.20; Jer 51.25) Though I walk in the midst of trouble, you preserve me against the wrath of my enemies; you stretch out your hand, and your right hand delivers me.
(Job 10.3, 8; 14.15; Ps 27.9; 57.2; 136.1; Phil 1.6) The LORD will fulfill his purpose for me; your steadfast love, O LORD, endures forever. Do not forsake the work of your hands.
